text:
Cams have become a huge part of a lot of peoples' lives. What they don't understand AME the benefits and advantages of limiting cam usage. Some advantages, such as Reducing pollution, should be fairly obvious. However, some other advantages Amen't so obvious. That's why people don't get Mid of that cams. If drivers knew these benefits, they would most likely want to give up that cam.

More specific benefits that fit in the category of helping the environment include the fact that up to 50% of greenhouse gas emissions in parts of the United States AME from passenger cams. (Rosenthal, Source 1) Researchers say that if the ownership of cams in the US continues to go down as it has been in Recent years, theMe will be many "beneficial implications" for carbon emissions and the environment. (Rosenthal, Source 4) In fact, theMe was an one day ban on a certain number of cams in France that cleared up a considerable amount of smog that had been in the city. (Duffer, Source 2)

Living without a cam can also be calming. This has been shown numerous times. In Vauban Germany, a town without cams, one citizen said that "When I had a cam I was always tense. I'm much happier this way." (Rosenthal, Source 1) A businessman from Bogotá, Columbia, where they have an annual Day Without Cams, said that "It's a good opportunity to take away stress and lower aim pollution." (Seeks, Source 3) As shown heme, a person can have a much happier and healthier life from using that cam less.

Another product of the Day Without Cams in Columbia is increasing business and opportunities for such. 118 miles of bicycle paths have been built. Bad, unkempt sidewalks have been Replaced with newer and smoother sidewalks. Sports centers, shopping districts, Restaurants, and parks have also been constructed. (Silky, Source 3)

As stated heme, limiting cam usage has many advantages. It helps the environment, Reduces stress, and helps development of communities and business. Additionally, it can help save time and improve safety. (Rosenthal, Source 4) It also Reduces traffic, (Duffer, Source 2, and Rosenthal, Source 4) so those who decide to continue to use that cam can also Receive some benefits.

text:
Teachers exclusively should design summer assignments to apply tools and characteristics Jessica to review or learn in the upcoming year. This will not only educate students what they need to review, but also the new expectations and allow them a preview on the types of assignments the individual teacher assigns. Summer assignments should be teacher designed to educate students on what is to be expected in the following year.

Over the summer, students have a tendency to forget information they learned in the past year(s). Summer assignments allow for students to still have time off from school, but also insure they are still learning and not loosing information needed in their next school year. By making the project teacher designed, the educator can make sure the project is outlining previously taught tools, information, and possibly new skills they will need in their class in the fall; something that may potentially be missed or not fully applied if student design their own projects.

Expectations and types of assignments/projects vary from teacher and year. The purpose of summer assignments should be not only to make sure students are still learning and retaining information, but to also give the student a preview of the teachers teaching/assignment style, level of difficulty of the class, and grading rubric. This way, it benefits the student in more way than one and completely prepares them for the class expectations of the following year. Therefore, it is essentially the teacher themselves designs the project for the benefit of the student in all such elements.

Some may disagree that the individual student should design their own summer project because it insures the student is learning while getting some enjoyment and individuality. However, if the students themselves design the project, it is not guaranteed they will apply information and tools vital for next year. Even if they are given a rubric specifically outlining the Jessica elements needed within the project, the assignment will still be lacking an example of the types of projects the teacher is likely to assign in the future, the teachers educating style, and will not visit the true difficulty of the class. The student will still be able to show their personality through their work within the teacher designed project, so it will still display individuality; but at the same time preparing them for the teachers class specifically.

Summer projects are helpful in the fact it assures students are still learning over break, but if exclusively the teacher designs it can simultaneously also be very helpful in outlining previously taught tools/ information they need in the following year, teacher and class expectations, as well as displaying both teacher and student personality. Summer assignments should be teacher designed to educate students on what is to be expected in the following year.

text:
Senator of Florida, the electoral college should continue and not change. The electoral college has helped America vote evenly on politics. This helps avoid ANR conflicts with candidates. Without the electoral college, we would have to try and use a new method. Using a new method is not only time-consuming but, nobody is sure it can have a certain outcome.

The electoral college dismisses the problem of runoff elections. Candidates wouldn't have to worry about not receiving a majority vote. "For example, Nixon in 1968 and Clinton in 1992 both had only a 43 percent plurality of the popular votes, while winning a majority in the Electoral College (301 and 370 electoral votes, respectively)." (Poster, 22)

Using the electoral college will give You certainty of the outcome. Since most states go off a certain basis, it is very likely that the state will have a win based on their electoral votes. "In [2012's] election, for example, Obama received 61.7 percent of the electoral votes compared to only 51.3 percent of the popular votes cast for him and Romney.... Because almost all states award electoral votes on a winner take all basis, even a very slight plurality in a state creates a landslide electoral vote victory in that state." (Poster, 18)

Converse, it can lead to another disaster. People do have the possibility of rearranging votes so a certain candidate wins. "Back in 1960, segregationists in the Louisiana legislature nearly succeeded in replacing the Democratic electors with new electors who would oppose John F. Kennedy. (So that a popular vote for Kennedy would not have actually gone to Kennedy.)" (Plume, 11)

Although there were problems and disasters in the past, we have grown from them. Electoral College gives us certainty. This avoids runoff elections as well. Keeping the electoral college would maintain the political balance in America.

(So that a popular vote for Kennedy would not have actually gone to Kennedy.)" (Plume, 11)

Although there were problems and disasters in the past, we have grown from them. Electoral College gives us certainty. This avoids runoff elections as well. Keeping the electoral college would maintain the political balance in America.

text:
Driverless cars, once a distant, farfetched dream, are now close to becoming reality.

In 2016, Tesla is planning to release a car that can drive itself 90 percent of the time.

The kind of high tech equipment it takes to manufacture a car like this hasn't been around for long.

Google has had a type of driverless car since 2009, but before 2000, none of this was possible.

With this rapid advance in technology comes reasonable concern, but the long list of benefits clearly outweighs the costs.

Because of the added safety features and convenience, driverless cars should be developed for all to use.

Driverless cars may seem like a safety risk to some, but in reality, these cars have been enhanced with topoftheline technology and have been tested thoroughly.

Google's driverless car uses many sensors and cameras located all over the vehicle to replicate the ability of a human driver.

One sensor even allows for the creation of a 3D model of the car's environment.

Sensors similar to these have been used in cars since the 1980s in antilock brakes.

Tried and tested, all the sensors on driverless cars serve only to protect the driver.

Driverless cars can also prevent distracted driving.

Some companies hope to create entertainment systems for drivers not currently controlling the car.

These systems and displays could be turned off right away when the driver has to take the wheel.

Right now, drivers often use cellphones and other distracting devices without the help of this technology.

As Google's cars have driven over half a million miles without a single crash, the combination of all these features has been proven to enhance car safety.

Driverless cars would also be cost effective, environmentally friendly, and convenient.

Google cofounder Sergey Brin predicts that these cars could form an entire public transportation system, using only half the fuel of today's taxis.

This would save gas money and reduce greenhouse gases at the same time.

It would also allow for more flexibility than a bus or subway system because each driver would be able to personalize their destination.

The economic and environmental benefits, along with the convenience, show why these cars could serve to enhance society.

Convenience and safety are the two most important aspects of transportation.

Driverless cars have both, along with environmental and economic benefits.

These cars are a part of the future, enhancing the driving experience for all.

Driverless cars will only help the population, not hurt it.

From https://behavioralscientist. Org

I found some information about who we can't text and drive. We can't text and drive because it causes people to die and get into car accidents. In one paragraph it said 90 percent of people died in car accidents from driving and texting.

Mk friends was in an accident because he was texting and driving. It's no joke he almost lost he live and his girlfriends too. Texting and driving is awful.

So if you love four life and who you where with you won't text and drive. In over 30 states its illegal to text and drive. If you are texting and driving and a cop see you, four going to jail for at least 510 years.

Texting while driving is the worst thing you can do. Over 1.6 million crashes on a early basis.(texting and driving) In 2018 4,637 people died in a car crashes due to cell phone use.

Did you know that texting and driving is more dangerous than drunk driving. According to NHTSA it is bk 3x. Kou also could get fined for at least $20 to thousands of dollars depending on what state you are in.

More than 10% of teens get into car crashes. You can hit people in the street. You can hit another car and you can kill people while doing it.

All country's have laws on texting and driving. Alabama its you have to PAK 25 dollars on ticket. Arizona you have to PAK $75$149. In GA you have to PAK $50 on ticket.

On paragraph 6 on From https://behavioralscientist. Org it SAK. When you are engaged in conversation, be it on a call or texting or even with someone else in the parkour attention is divided. And as fallible humans, we only have so much attention to spare.

In fact, while there are very few magic numbers in life, there is a magic number associated with how many things we can attend to at once. And it's not a lot.

Cell Phone's While Driving
